website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-operate plunger with fast pitting. Designed for convenience and easy cleanup.
pros: Unique design with large pit compartment - perfect to pit a large amount of olives
Cleanup is easy thanks to dishwasher-safe removable parts
Plunging mechanism is manageable for all ages and strengths
Well constructed to last a long time
cons: Must hold pitter during plunging so it doesn’t move around too much

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.  Fast.  Worth Every Penny.
customer_reviews.text: This tool is a game changer! I live in Michigan where u-pick sweet cherries are plentiful, however most orchards will only pit pie cherries because sweet cherries are too big for their equipment. This works even on large black cherries and it takes SO MUCH LESS TIME. I used to use a hand pitter, one by one, and it took forever. Hours. Days of my life. This thing just powered through 2 pounds of cherries in 5 minutes. The occasional cherry will get stuck in the hopper, but it’s easy to pop out. Easy to clean. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This an amazing tool!
customer_reviews.text: I have Bush Cherries that produce sweet little cherries. Pitting them is usually daunting but with this Cherry Pitter it made the job easy! With the small cherries I just feed them into the pitter one at a time. Easy to clean. Easy to use! Hightly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Gigi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for sour cherries.
customer_reviews.text: Quickly and efficiently pits my annual haul of sour cherries for making pie filling. I find it helps to use my left hand to help feed the cherries in a line through the pitter while driving the plunger with right hand. I don't expect this to catch all the pits. The pitted cherries are fed onto a plastic tray; when that is full I use two hands to check and manually remove leftover pits before moving into my canning pot. This two-part process is quite fast. This device is easy to clean, overall very user-friendly.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Gets most pits - not all
customer_reviews.text: I liked this alright. We have a tree so had a lot of cherries to do. This was faster than the individual pit puncher; but I got a lot of hanging chad pits. sometimes i'd see them, sometimes not. in the end, it's a much faster way to 'mostly' pit a bunch of cherries. I freeze dried mine and had to write "CAUTION. May Contain Pits!" on each bag. we also got the individual pit puncher. it works better, but only because you're doing one at a time and paying more attention to each cherry.
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well at all.
customer_reviews.text: Nope, nope, nope. I can't believe this got any positive review. I tried every which way to make it work. I so wanted to make it work, but it did not. The cherries were either mashed, or still had the seed attached or were not pitted at all. These were sour pie cherries. It looks like another year of pitting by hand. ugh!
customer_reviews.author: Kevans

customer_reviews.title: Really good pitter
customer_reviews.text: This is an initial review since I didn't send many cherries though it yet but I didn't have any real problems. I sent two types of cherries through it, a normal sized firmer variety and a very large variety that was soft when I got them. The normal sized went through fantastically with no missed pits and they plunger lifted the cherries up and down the spout. The large cherries had trouble even fitting down the chute and the plunger couldn't pick them up because they were too soft and large. But, after figuring out how to flip them out with my finger instead it worked pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: selfcontrol5@gmail.com
customer_reviews.text: Works great! A time saver. Two pounds of cherries had a couple of pits left so we did check but that's not bad for as many as we kept adding to the top.I love having the bottom to collect the pits, less messy. Easy height to work with. We had to trust the action of the plunger. I received this product quickly. The first one I received from Amazon had a small crack in the clear base from shipping and they replaced the unit for me.
customer_reviews.author: RicaCostaRica

customer_reviews.title: Slick tool - but CRACKED with FIRST USE.
customer_reviews.text: Received my cherry pitter today and had a gallon of sour cherries waiting so I got right to it! This thing is slick and beats the heck out of individually putting. You do about have to roll one at a time through it, otherwise unpitted cherries roll right through with the pitted cherry and it does occasionally get a little backed up but still worked well. HOWEVER, the pit bin cracked clean through! My first use, and it’s got a crack that will now let juice seep through. So extremely disappointed there - especially for paying nearly $30!
customer_reviews.author: SydneyS

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This simple device helped us pit nearly 40 lbs of our sweet cherries in under an hour. So easy. While my husband pitted, I washed the cherries, kept his bowls filled, and bagged them for the freezer. Because it was a time-saver, we felt we could pit the whole tree for smoothies all year! I wouldn’t use it for pie cherries though since pie cherries are too small and delicate. But for sweet cherries, this really works well. So worth it.
customer_reviews.author: B.B.

customer_reviews.title: Needs a bit of babysitting
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for something that you can use to mindlessly punch out cherry pits, this is not it. For smaller cherries it works fairly well, but still misses a few pits. With larger cherries it misses more pits (maybe 25%) and takes a lot of hopper management. It is probably faster and less messy than a hand pitter, but after biting on a couple of pits and realizing I would need to check every cherry.....I was not as pleased with my purchase. Also, as you can see from the picture, the rubber gasket below the plunger was damaged and needed to be replaced after pitting 30 lbs of cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Tundratrader

customer_reviews.title: Check your cherries carefully!
customer_reviews.text: The cherries have finally arrived, and I was eager to try my new cherry pitter! I must say, it made quick work of the two quarts of cherries I bought for a cherry pie. I finished in about 15 minutes! But just to be on the safe side, I donned some latex gloves and checked each cherry. I'm glad I did, because I found about 10 cherries that still had pits inside (see the small dish in my photo). Still, I'm very happy with the cherry pitter and would definitely recommend it. Just be sure to check your cherries carefully as a few pits will be missed.
customer_reviews.author: K. Van Kainen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money, time, energy
customer_reviews.text: I could not find my usual cherry pitter that works perfectly and I saw this on Amazon. It looked like such a timesaver... Easily 50% of the cherries still had pits in them, and the juice sprayed halfway up my window, as well as all over my counter top. My kitchen looked like a scene out of a B rated horror film. I didn’t even give this to the Goodwill people. It went straight into the trash. I guess it’s true what they say – if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is.
customer_reviews.author: SUZICOOKS

customer_reviews.title: Huge time saver
customer_reviews.text: Used to use the old school pitter that screwed onto a mason jar, well NOT ANY MORE!! With this I as able to pit 50lbs of cherries in about an hour and a half, only taking breaks to rest the old arm! Now the speed and ease is undeniable, but there are a couple draw backs. The unit tends to let to many go through once you discharge a pitted cherry, but that pretty much happens with all pitters. Also the first one I ordered was cracked, but it was replaced quickly with no questions. But not sure how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Cole Wisco

customer_reviews.title: really helpful tool
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully I got one day delivery on this pitter/stoner. I have one tree of small tart pie cherries that was loaded with cherries this year. I had washed and sorted a couple of gallons of cherries and hand pitted a quart or so before it arrived, holding the remainder in the fridge. I finished them up in short order after washing and setting it up. It does miss a few pits, but I sorted through the pitted cherries a batch at a time and threw the un-pitted ones back in the hopper and ran them through again. Very much faster than anything I have used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this was just me. First of all, the plastic was cracked on the container that holds the pits when I got it, but it was still workable so I tried it out. I think I got 50/50 on the pits at absolute best, and not only was juice getting everywhere(I was hoping it would stay pretty contained with the design) but the cherries kept getting stuck in the chamber. Overall, something we probably won't use again :(
customer_reviews.author: jen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but still misses some pits
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Works very well, but every once in a great while you will have a cherry with pit off center, and this machine will miss it. So be sure to check the cherries to make sure that all pits have been removed. You do have to do minor disassembly to clean, but no big deal. Huge improvement over doing this with a paring knife or other cave age tool.
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: This one is decent...
customer_reviews.text: We bought 2 different Cherry Pitters, and we are much more pleased with this one. As you can see in the video, it does the job it is meant to do. The only complaint we have is the hopper doesn't work if you put more than a handful and feed it one at a time, if you put a handful in and dont control the flow, it gets clogged. But we have 20 gallons of Cherries this batch and is way faster than doing by hand!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm!
customer_reviews.text: I don't write many reviews, usually only when I get an item that either fails miserably or performs fart above expectations. This little cherry pitter I am happy to say is the latter and works awesome. Maybe it's just the cherries I have on my tree, but this thing pits them faster than my wife could stem them and drop them in the hopper. It was like a machine gun. We had about 5lbs of cherries pitted in no time at all and not one had a hanging pit or a missed pit. Best 25 bucks I ever spent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty good
customer_reviews.text: If you have a need for pitting 2 cups or more at a time, I would definitely recommend this. It does miss one out of 10 but it's not a big deal. It doesn 't work well if your cherries are much smaller or larger than an average cherry. Smaller ones get clogged up in the chute and larger ones require your finger to set them at the right position for extraction. I would probably buy this again but wish it had a smaller storage footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: This makes eating cherries sooo much better
customer_reviews.text: This removes the cherry pits so that you can eat the fresh cherry without having to spit out the pit or wonder what to do with the pits after you've enjoyed the cherry. Easy to clean and a well built design. Excellent for feeding fresh cherries to kids or grandkids and not have to worry about them choking on the cherry pit! We love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Packaging problem
customer_reviews.text: It works fairly well - of a small container of cherries, it missed one of the pits. (That is an issue if you are feeding someone who cannot spit them out.) The big problem is that it came with a crack in the bottom piece. It isn't worth the hassle of returning it, so I am stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Tony's family

customer_reviews.title: NOT for sweet cherries!
customer_reviews.text: First order had a broken plastic box; it was quickly replaced. This does NOT work for Bings or Rainiers; the fruit is too big for the hole. It may work for smaller pie cherries/sour cherries as some reviews have noted. Disappointing for sure. Still looking for the perfect cherry pitter...the single use, hand held is still the most reliable I have found. If this is your intended use, don’t buy this item!
customer_reviews.author: MamaSue

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: Just received the above, gave it a quick cleaning and it works great. There are a few quirks, but it sure makes pitting cherries very easy. Read the directions and don't throw out the 2 white rubber tabs...they go into the machine. Look at the height of the discharge shoot....and use a container lower than that. Wash your cherries and pull stems off, and PIT away !!!! I highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kent Rockwood Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Its All About the Pits, Baby!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cherry pitter because I wanted to make cherry pies. The device is very easy to use and you can pit 5-6 cups of cherries fairly fast. It is easy to clean and store away after you have finished. I would have given it 5-star but after using is several times, I found it missed some of the pits, which I found in my pies. Thank goodness no one broke a tooth.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: With a name like Leifheit.... what could go wrong?
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new cherry pitter having somehow misplaced the very good OXO we once had. This one, made by Leifheit, conjured up BMW-like German craftsmanship, durability and a long life. Despite their claims of a 60 year tradition of being "one of the leading providers of household products in Europe..." it fractured the inexpensive plastic box that the pits go into. 60 years and they can't provide a reliable product. The pictures show fracture cracks after pitting a few cherries. This is an inferior product. We will be sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing 20lbs of cherries all pitted in under an hour!
customer_reviews.author: Ashke

customer_reviews.title: Fast Cherry Pitter
customer_reviews.text: Product came as expected. It was easy to take apart. Pull the handle up and squeeze in and the top comes off. Be gentle with the spring. I already misplaced one of the foam parts that you have to put instead of the cardboard (used keeping the cherry pitter from getting ruined in transit); so, keep on the look out as there are two available. We washed and used it right away to make drunken cherries (one with vodka/ one with rum) and to freeze cherries prior to vacuum sealing. It made very fast work for pitting about two pint jars and 8 cups worth of cherries! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KelBecMad

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This came with a cracked pit container, one contact and they had another on the way. The only negative is that my parents 80 yo and 101 yo have to use pliers to remove the part that pushes down. Otherwise they love it and call when they have "pitting parties".
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Cherry canon
customer_reviews.text: My four year old calls it a cherry canon. He is able to use it (with adult supervision) its pit puncher is sharp. It misses about 1 in every 20 pits but once you get a feel for it you can pit a 5 gallon bucket in under 10 minutes. It would have keep going but my 4 year old ran out of cherries and was reaching for the bag of grapes. It went into the dishwasher and came out clean.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Allen

customer_reviews.title: This product sucks!!
customer_reviews.text: The only positive thing about this product is that it came on time. It sucks cherries . It pits 1 out of 15 cherries... maybe. If you don’t hold it, it falls apart and splatters everywhere. If the cherries are too small they will fall through the opening. So run away from this product. DO NOT BUT IT. You are better off hand pitting your cherries.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Millen

customer_reviews.title: Can't live without it...
customer_reviews.text: When cherry picking, brought back a bucket full... pitted them in no time at all. Smooth, flowerless operation. Can't ask for anything more. Now I don't think I can live without it. No way am I gonna buy cherries at my local store, eat them and spit the pit out like some kind of an animal...
customer_reviews.author: Cobra

customer_reviews.title: Works well but not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: It works well put the first time I used it the container that the pits fall into broke. so now what do I do?
customer_reviews.author: Anne K Robinsin

customer_reviews.title: The kitchen accessory is perfect for pitting a boatload of cherries
customer_reviews.text: The kitchen accessory is perfect for pitting a boatload of cherries. I make make mead with cherries and so need to put almost 20 lbs of cherries. When I pitted the cherries by hand last time, I said i would never do this again. Now this unit, you can pit about 10 lbs of cherries in roughly half an hour. It takes some time to get the right rhythm. Every once in while it will miss a pit, so it is not 100% perfect. Also depending how round the cherries are, you may have to help them along to get to the pitting well. There is no worry that it will injure you, it is well protected.
customer_reviews.author: electonics hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Very fast. Only problem was the second set of boxes of cherrys were just huge so they didnt fit. The average cherry fits perfectly. For the super big ones I grabbed a small jam jar and drilled a pit sized hole in the center. Them I use the plunger part from this and did it manually. It worked great but was slower.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: This pitter is fantastic. I was able to pit all my tree’s sour cherries in a fraction of the time. Out of thousands of cherries, I only had a handful that were less than perfectly pitted. While I love cherry season, I usually dread the work necessary to pick, pit, and process all the fruit from my tree. After using this to pit what I considered a good enough harvest, I actually went back out to the tree and picked in a few more gallons because it was so fast. Sorry, birds! Less for you this year.
customer_reviews.author: C. McLeod

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got this for my first cherry pitting of the year. It was easy and fast as I needed. I would suggest not to "top it off" with too many cherries at a time. I put in about 1 1/2 cups at a time and it seemed to feed through very well. Otherwise you might get a pile up in the shoot.
customer_reviews.author: jo ellen

customer_reviews.title: Great at this pricepoint
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. On fresh sweet cherries it would miss about 1 pit in150. For smaller canning cherries it would miss maybe 1 in 50, but you can feel a difference when it misses a pit. The catch basin is huge, so you can keep going without stopping. For the price point it is an absolutely fantastic option
customer_reviews.author: FarmKid

customer_reviews.title: For extra large cherries and maybe it will seed the cherry.
customer_reviews.text: This does not work, it pushes the cherries through the hole, if it throws out a cherry or several at a time, the seeds are still attached to the cherry, I am so very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Great product. About 95 percent of the time the pit totally separated from cherry. The other 5 percent of the time we were left with it still slightly attached. It was easy to see and then remove it on our own. Would definitely recommend. Made making a pie a lot more fun and less time consuming.
customer_reviews.author: travelllllller

customer_reviews.title: It’s a miracle machine!
customer_reviews.text: What neat tool for removing the pit out of a cherry. It basically punches the seed out with a push on the handle. It will s a sturdy and easy to clean gadget. I’ll be making homemade cherry pies now!
customer_reviews.author: Jpz

customer_reviews.title: Pitting cherries is a piece of cake with this product.
customer_reviews.text: It did a great job pitting a lot of cherries. You still must check them all because some pits stick to the cherries. I would say this does an excellent, though not perfect, job. So much better than most pitting gadgets.
customer_reviews.author: Marni C.

customer_reviews.title: Great cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to put a large amount of cherries that my neighbor graciously shared with me! It was very easy to use and so quick in getting the job done whether it was small cherries or larger cherries. Very easy clean up and wonderful holding receptacle for the pits! I highly recommend this to anyone who dreads putting cherries! Makes this task a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Socalmary1

customer_reviews.title: Life chaining from a cherry Pitt perspective
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a charm. Pitted 20 pounds of cherries in about 20 minutes and that was destemming too which takes the most time...If you get going to enthusiastically a cherry or two might get through Pitt in tact but who what I tell everyone if they get a Pitt it's good luck for year... Brilliant gadget
customer_reviews.author: dee wagner

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use twice as fast as hand pitter.  Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This pitter is awesome. Only complaont is sometimes the small cherries get stuck in the shute. Its easy to use. I have an issue with my right thumb and this is soo easy to use. Dishwasher safe. However get a pipe scrubber for the pit hole to clean ot propperly.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie w

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about this product...just didn’t see how it would work but wow! Genius design, I like the top tray that holds multiple cherries and you just feed them through! Quick, easy, awesome! Super easy to rinse out after. I’ll be using this for years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, close to the antique metal pitter I hope to inherit some day (can't afford one). My husband pitted 20 lb. of cherries in a short time. We were amazed that every fruit was pitted, the pits were very clean, and there was minimal juice in the bin. Have recommended it to others. Cherry season is very short here, and pitting by hand or with a single-fruit punch pitter that quickly cramps the hand isn't worth the effort. Now we can freeze for cobbler or make jam quickly with no pain.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!  This is great!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! Was able to pit sooo many cherries in a matter of a few minutes, now look out home made cherry ice cream, pies etc. thank you soo much!
customer_reviews.author: Lady Lee

customer_reviews.title: pretty fast and keeps the shape of the cherry intact ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for pie cherries, pretty fast and keeps the shape of the cherry intact as well as the juice is kept inside. Works best to keep some cherries in one hand and feed them into the tray as you go. They roll down into place for pitting. However if you load the little in feed area as shown in the pick the cherries jam and you have to unjam them to go into the pit chute. Next year I will be using it for the bing cherries for sure, Just got it to late to use on them this year.
customer_reviews.author: Pete McElmo Canyon

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without this??
customer_reviews.text: So simple to use, works on cherries of all sizes. I pitted a huge bag of Bings and Rainiers in short order. I'd guess I got 99.9% of all pits out, and almost no damage to the fruit. You can process a big handful at a time!
customer_reviews.author: M. Deitrick

customer_reviews.title: It gets most of the pits so be careful
customer_reviews.text: This does not always knock out a pit. It’s not a bad design but it’s not entirely effective. I bit down on a pit that I didn’t expect. Ouch!
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Just because there is a whole doesn’t mean the pit is out
customer_reviews.text: So after you use this product. Go back and cut the cherries in half. You will see that there will be many that didn’t get pitted
customer_reviews.author: cutecowgirl39

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed. I bought this pitter because you could fit several cherries in the bowl at one time; thought the process might go faster. Not so. Press the pitter handle and several cherries would fall through. I had to fish them out of the bowl. Also, the cherries kept getting stuck on the metal pitter. So annoying. Not happy at all. It was faster to do by hand. Returned!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam F.

customer_reviews.title: misses some pits
customer_reviews.text: it is easy to use easy to clean and seems durable. i was pitting bing cherries and it pitted about 2/3 of them the others i had to manually remove. that being said it was much faster so it still took less time than doing them 1 by 1.
customer_reviews.author: matthew todd

customer_reviews.title: ... for a cherrystone remover for years - was so happy that I found one on-line - and it works
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a cherrystone remover for years - was so happy that I found one on-line - and it works. However in processing the cherries through the chute - the base got a hairline crack - I may need to but duck tape around it when i use it again for the crack does not get bigger
customer_reviews.author: summer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!! We just froze 24 pounds of cherries (and that is without the pits, probably was five pounds of pits that were removed). I just got this pitter in the mail today and used it and I am so darned impressed. So fast, so easy, ingenious design, once you have done it awhile you know the sounds it makes and can tell if a random one didn't work and you can do it again, rarely do they not pit it correctly. This gets a 6 star from me!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scrappy Happy

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable or accurate.
customer_reviews.text: The base that catches the pits arrived broken. I was too lazy to send it back, but you should still know that. The cherries basically need to be a certain size, or it won't hit all the pits. Overall, it's better than going through cherries one by one, but it's just OK still.
customer_reviews.author: thompsjeTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Makes cherry pitting so fast
customer_reviews.text: When I got the hang of how much pressure and how fast it was great. We dehydrated cherries and this made it so fast
customer_reviews.author: rita atkinson

customer_reviews.title: cherry pitter
customer_reviews.text: this product does push the pits out however the cherries don't always fall out of the hole. You have to pick them out sometimes. you have to put this product up on something in order for the cherries to fall out into a bowl. unless you have a very low bowl for the cherries to fall into.
customer_reviews.author: Annette

customer_reviews.title: awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the easiest cherry pitters I have ever used! So easy to assemble, use and clean. I pitted about 12 cups of cherries in 20 minutes... would absolutely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: goldie ptomey

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for another pitter that I got a little carried away on and bent the steel shaft that knocks the pit out.
customer_reviews.author: William R. Gerding

customer_reviews.title: For the money, a great pitter.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, given the relatively low cost. I am beyond impressed. I pitted around 10 cups of small cherries in less than 45 minutes. I can't imagine don't that one, or even six at a time like some of the pitters. Well worth the money my only complaint is that the little rubber insert that slides in to keep the cherry from falling into the reservoir had to be trimmed down a little to line up properly.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: If this was supposed to be ceramic it's not. It's plastic. I paid too much. Very sad. I could have gotten the 20.00 one if I wanted plastic. This was 34.00.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Murphy

customer_reviews.title: This pitter is not the pits!
customer_reviews.text: I had so many cherries to pit this year. I did them partially frozen and that helped. It doesn't always get all the pits free from the berry, but pretty darn close! Three 5 gallon buckets later and I am done.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Merriman

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Little challenging to clean but so worth it! Also, I had more success feeding in one cherry at a time rather than a batch. Still better than hand pitting!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Davis

customer_reviews.title: It does its job.
customer_reviews.text: It arrived with a cracked pit receiver bottom bin. Rather than wait for a new one I patched myriad cracks with tape (but could not find the missing piece.) Works well and since I’ve lost all my teeth I can once again enjoy my favorite fruit. Glad I got it. Just hope it lasts as long as I do, which won’t be too much longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good chserry pitter
customer_reviews.text: only pits one at a time but easy and quick. very easy clean up
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P.

customer_reviews.title: This works okay most of the time but could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This works okay most of the time but could be better. It is better than trying to de-pit the cherries by knife. It doesn't always work so you have to be careful to watch each cherry go through to make sure the seed is removed. Placing the cherry in correctly makes a big difference. Also, the size of the cherry is a factor. The bigger the cherry the more difficult to use. Still it's better than doing it manually.
customer_reviews.author: someone else

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Picking --- errr, Pitting With Amazon.com!
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool. I had never used a pitter. It is super easy to use and-- best of all-- it works! It is also fun. I read many customer reviews on this model and other models, too before I decided to purchase this one. I made the right choice. I gave it 4 stars now for two reasons: (1) I have not used it enough to give 5-stars, and (2) I am having trouble getting the lid to snap on but think I may not have gotten the hang of it yet. It is made of heavy plastic and is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Beje

customer_reviews.title: Great useful device for the gadget freak (among us)
customer_reviews.text: Really works well. But, a bit hard to clean and store. Too bad cherry season is so short, or I would use it more. Works as expected. I had a broken plastic base, and they gave me a new one. So, this vendor is A1 in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Used a handful of times and broke
customer_reviews.text: This works great - when it works. Often got clogged, or missed pits and then the handle flew off and the spring broke. All after a handful of times using it. Ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Olivier

customer_reviews.title: I have one just like it and it works great for pitting pie cherries ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift. I have one just like it and it works great for pitting pie cherries as long as you drop them in and don't jam them in. The steel plunger is a must. Have had plastic plungers and they do not work at all. Best one that I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best I know of
customer_reviews.text: This stoner works very well and can be almost foolproof by watching the cherries as they exit the chute. this will prevent the occasional cherry from slipping through. Quickness with the plunger prevents misses and makes the process fast. It also is relatively easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A. Moechnig

customer_reviews.title: Fast & easy
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product. I have an old-school crank pitter but the cherries are mashed. Okay for jam or leathers but I wanted to dehydrate some. Bought this and just pitted 3 lbs of cherries in less than 15 minutes. Could not be happier
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B Good

customer_reviews.title: Only 1/2 of the cherries actually got pitted!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on the good reviews. The only good thing I found was it is fast. BUT fast isn’t helpful when a good 1/2 of the pits are still in the cherries. It might work better on small cherries. Plus my kitchen was a mess - cherry juice everywhere! If I could return it I would!! This is a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: DAL

customer_reviews.title: Does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: We have a cherry tree and for years have been pitting the cherries by hand. With this gadget pitting time does go a lot quicker and more of the "meat" stays inside. I didn't give it five stars because you have to really watch each cherry as it rolls out to make certain the pit is indeed out. Also we really can't load the cherries on the top like the picture shows without cherries rolling through (pits included). That being said it still cuts the time dramatically and is worth the money if you plan on having to pit a lot of cherries.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work like I expected I gave up and pitted my cherries by hand with a knife
customer_reviews.author: Jewels Clements

customer_reviews.title: amazing best ever
customer_reviews.text: well .........what can i say .........the first one i had............ identical to the one i ordered, lasted ,30 years...............say no more ................no questions what so ever ...............if you want it to last and you want it to be good......... .order this one..........on sale or not ....................
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cherry Pitting Just Got Easier
customer_reviews.text: This item works well for me. I've already frozen 4 quarts of cherries, and plan to freeze more. As a senior with arthritis, pitting cherries is difficult. Not with my new toy! The owner of the farm where I usually pick cherries recommended the paper clip method of pitting them. It was very effective, very time consuming, and very painful. I just wish I'd looked on Amazon for one a couple of years ago.
customer_reviews.author: NeAnni Ife

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pitter expecting to pit sour cherries in a timely manner. Also purchased a smaller cherry pitter for $10 which pitted 6 cherries at a time. The $10 pitter out performed this machine. The Leifheit machine worked well with larger cherries but the small ones seem to get clogged in the chute. Spent a lot of time unclogging the pitter. Nice product but more satisfied with the end results provided by the $10 pitter.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love using this. I can process so many cherries in record time which now makes cooking with cherries a breeze. It soooo fast, soooo sturdy, and soooo very easy to clean. It is perfect for my needs. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Verified Purchaser

customer_reviews.title: Cherry-pick
customer_reviews.text: If cherries were big enough , it would work. It will miss some seeds
customer_reviews.author: parvin

customer_reviews.title: East to use, good product
customer_reviews.text: Did 30 lbs of cherries using the Leifheit 37200 and the Kitchen Gizmo pitters. Leifheit was less messy, less missed pits - can see them drop. First 6lbs took 20 minutes using both devices. Went quicker as we got use to them
customer_reviews.author: elvis peppers

customer_reviews.title: That was fast!
customer_reviews.text: My cherry pie making is a lot faster now! Still, be careful. There's about a 15% failure rate in pitting if you're going to fast. German technology can even conquer the cherry.
customer_reviews.author: J. Newhouse

customer_reviews.title: This cherry pitter is so awesome and saves so much time
customer_reviews.text: Yes, i would definitely purchase again. Ten years ago, I purchased one of these and while it still works, there was a cracked in the top of the handle from lots of use. This cherry pitter is so awesome and saves so much time. Love the way it's set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.text: I ordered one as a gift and it arrived really late but it was great, he loved it so I ordered one for myself and the plasic container pit catcher was cracked and broken when I opened it and I couldn't use it
customer_reviews.author: kristal

customer_reviews.title: Makes quick work out of a real chore.
customer_reviews.text: This even worked on thawed cherries that were very mushy. Sometimes I had to push them through but the part that pierces the cherry is nice and sturdy. When I finally did fresh cherries it went fast and clean. Just watch the you tube video where the woman allows the cherries to flow into the chamber in a line - more or less. When it did it like that the work went fast.
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: Order today!  SO easy to put!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the bomb!! Easy to Pitt in seconds. I did a big box of cherries in minutes. Best money sent. None of this stupid tricks really work like a straw! This is the real deal. So glad I read the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of misses on larger cherries
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well on larger cherries from Washington state. Easy to bend the plunger too. Maybe smaller cherries will work better but I haven't tried them.
customer_reviews.author: Chopper

customer_reviews.title: Missed pits
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t get every pit.... maybe 8 out of 10 Trouble with larger cherries Messy, splatters a lot
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: High quality for the same price as the garbage at most local markets!
customer_reviews.text: High quality product. Sturdy, efficient, easy to use, and easy to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Sari

customer_reviews.title: space saver and good first purchase
customer_reviews.text: my first time buying a cherry pitter and I found this to be my favorite. it was a little confusing putting it together but after a short time it became easy. when you clean it, you have to make sure you get the handle, when you push down, since some leftover cherry bits get on the tiny hook. it doesn't take up allot of space and the pits just fall into the clear container.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: efficient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two cherry pitters - one hand held and this one. I had small tart cherries and once I got in a rhythm it worked great. Also worked for larger cherries too. It is easy to use and clean. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne E. Lacina

customer_reviews.title: Works mostly
customer_reviews.text: Works ok does not pit every one you have to inspect after use
customer_reviews.author: baker22

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Good but not as good as described. Juice splatters due to the fact that you have to be aggressive with the plunger. The seed does not always get removed, the cherry sticks to the plunger or/and does not come out of chute unless you are aggressive with it. Decent but not impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cost
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just be sure to double-check the cherries as sometimes the pits do not fall through and gets stuck in the meat of the cherry.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Newman

customer_reviews.title: This is the best food preparation device since the electric can opener
customer_reviews.text: This is the best food preparation device since the electric can opener. It's pricey bit worth ever penny. The amount of time saved in manually pitting cherries indivdually is worth the expense on the front end. I love it. No more concerns about picking too many cherries for fear of spending hours and hours at the kitchen sink pitting cherries. Your worries are over with this device.
customer_reviews.author: amorganfloyd

customer_reviews.title: 04 STARS
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in excellent condition. Product worked great. After every 100 cherries pitted I would wash and rinse the pitter. I found that leaving it wet/damp during operation helped the pitter work smoother. The juice buildup can cause the pitter to gum up so leave it damp. I rated it 04 stars because it is all plastic. I am not sure how many years it will last. But for the price it is a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: erik leff

customer_reviews.title: A Time Saver
customer_reviews.text: The saved me so much time this year over my old cherry stoner. Very quick and easy to use. Only draw back was with larger cherries it didn’t always get the pits, but I would still buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Makes hole, but leaves pit
customer_reviews.text: Splatters cherry juice everywhere Doesn't remove pit at all Misses the pit altogether most times and if it removes it the pit is still stuck to the cherry, if you are lucky that is Pure garbage Avoid
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: SAVES A TON OF TIME
customer_reviews.text: LOVE IT!! Saved me SO MUCH TIME!! Just make sure you put in the rubber stopper!
customer_reviews.author: PEGGY

product_meta.title: Leifheit Cherry Pitter with Stone Catcher Container | Cherry Stone Remover Tool
product_meta.description: Style Name:ClassicHaving fresh cherries is a seasonal favorite. Desserts and preserves are best when made with fresh cherries but who has time to remove the pits from the large amount of cherries needed for a recipe? Leifheit's Cherrymat Stoner offers the most efficient way to stone cherries. With the Cherrymat Stoner, you can achieve rapid removal of stones from fresh and conserved cherries, leaving the fruit intact. The Cherrymat processes 25-pound of cherries in only one hour. A stainless steel plunger removes the pit from the cherry and captures it in the container. Canning and baking with cherries has never been faster or easier. Dishwasher safe; 2-year warranty.
feature_bullets: HAND OPPERATED cherry pit remover with stainless steel plunger
DISHWASHER SAFE container catches all of the seeds from the cherry pit tool
SAVES TIME: Prep your cherries quickly and easily
EASY PREP for your canning, baking, preservatives and much more
10.5 inch H x 4.5 inch W x 6 inch D

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,215 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
